intro: Cryptanthopsis navioides, commonly known as the Navajo broom, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and it has a mat-forming structure that helps it thrive in arid environments. Cryptanthopsis navioides is adapted to rocky soils and full sun, making it a hardy species found in desert and semi-desert regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
